jnxoptIfExtMibModule.name: jnxoptIfExtMibModule

revisions.description: Update FEC error count to Counter64
Enhancement for OTN PM 24 hour TCA thresholds

jnxoptIfExtMibModule.contactinfo: Email: Juniper Technical Assistance Center Juniper Networks, Inc. 1194 N. Mathilda Avenue Sunnyvale, CA 94089 E-mail: support@juniper.net
jnxoptIfExtMibModule.description: The MIB module to describe Black Link extension to rfc3591. It is the enterprise version of the draft draft-galikunze-ccamp-g-698-2-snmp-mib-02

JnxoptIfChannelSpacing.name: JnxoptIfChannelSpacing
JnxoptIfChannelSpacing.description: Channel spacing 1 - 100 GHz 2 - 50 GHz 3 - 25 GHz 4 - 12.5 GHz 5 - 6.25 GHz

JnxoptIfBitRateLineCoding.name: JnxoptIfBitRateLineCoding
JnxoptIfBitRateLineCoding.description: Optical tributary signal class 1 - NRZ 2.5G (from nominally 622 Mbit/s to nominally 2.67 Gbit/s) 2 - NRZ 10G nominally 2.4 Gbit/s to nominally 10.71 Gbit/s. 3 - 40 Gbits/s 4 - 100 Gbits/s 5 - 400 Gbits/s 40 Gbits/s and above are under study.

JnxoptIfFiberTypeRecommendation.name: JnxoptIfFiberTypeRecommendation
JnxoptIfFiberTypeRecommendation.description: Fiber Types - ITU-T Recs G.652, G.653, G.654 and G.655 One for recommendation and one for category. G.652 A, B, C, D G.653 A, B G.654 A, B, C G.655 C, D, E G.656 G.657 A, B

JnxoptIfFiberTypeCategory.name: JnxoptIfFiberTypeCategory
JnxoptIfFiberTypeCategory.description: Fiber Types - ITU-T Recs G.652, G.653, G.654 and G.655 G.652 A, B, C, D G.653 A, B G.654 A, B, C G.655 C, D, E G.656 G.657 A, B Categories - A, B, C, D and E

JnxoptIfOTNType.name: JnxoptIfOTNType
JnxoptIfOTNType.description: This parameter indicates the parameters for the table are for the Near End or Far End performance data. 1 - Near End 2 - Far End

JnxoptIfOTNDirection.name: JnxoptIfOTNDirection
JnxoptIfOTNDirection.description: Indicates the direction as Rx/Tx or bi-directional.

JnxoptIfOTNLayer.name: JnxoptIfOTNLayer
JnxoptIfOTNLayer.description: This parameter indicates the parameters for the table are for OTUk, ODUk, TCM performance data. 1 - OTUk 2 - ODUk 3 - TCM The ODUk layer and TCM sublayer PM is not related to the black link PM management, but since this could be a common PM model for the ODUk layer and TCM layers, we include it here so it may be used for simple scenarios where only lower order ODUk or higher order ODUk is present. For scenarios where both lower order ODUk and higher order ODUk are present, further extension to the MIB model is required, in particular for the indexing for these layers.

JnxoptIfOTNOChAlarms.name: JnxoptIfOTNOChAlarms
JnxoptIfOTNOChAlarms.description: This is the possible alarms from the OCh and OTUk layer.

JnxoptIfOTNODUkTcmAlarms.name: JnxoptIfOTNODUkTcmAlarms
JnxoptIfOTNODUkTcmAlarms.description: This is the alarms from the ODUk and TCM layer.

jnxoptIfOPSmConfigTable.name: jnxoptIfOPSmConfigTable
jnxoptIfOPSmConfigTable.description: A table of OPS General config parameters.

jnxoptIfOPSmConfigEntry.name: jnxoptIfOPSmConfigEntry
jnxoptIfOPSmConfigEntry.description: An conceptual row of OPS General config parameters.

jnxoptIfOPSmDirectionality.name: jnxoptIfOPSmDirectionality
jnxoptIfOPSmDirectionality.description: Indicates the directionality of the entity.

jnxoptIfOPSmFiberTypeRecommendation.name: jnxoptIfOPSmFiberTypeRecommendation
jnxoptIfOPSmFiberTypeRecommendation.description: Fiber type as per fibre types are chosen from those defined in ITU-T Recs G.652, G.653, G.654, G.655, G.656 and G.657.

jnxoptIfOPSmFiberTypeCategory.name: jnxoptIfOPSmFiberTypeCategory
jnxoptIfOPSmFiberTypeCategory.description: Fiber type as per fibre types are chosen from those defined in ITU-T Recs G.652, G.653, and G.655. The categories are A, B, C, D and E.

jnxoptIfOChConfigExtTable.name: jnxoptIfOChConfigExtTable
jnxoptIfOChConfigExtTable.description: A table of Och General config extension parameters

jnxoptIfOChConfigExtEntry.name: jnxoptIfOChConfigExtEntry
jnxoptIfOChConfigExtEntry.description: A conceptual row that contains OCh configuration extension information of an interface.

jnxoptIfOChMiminumChannelSpacing.name: jnxoptIfOChMiminumChannelSpacing
jnxoptIfOChMiminumChannelSpacing.description: A minimum nominal difference in frequency (GHz) between two adjacent channels.

jnxoptIfOChBitRateLineCoding.name: jnxoptIfOChBitRateLineCoding
jnxoptIfOChBitRateLineCoding.description: Optical tributary signal class NRZ 2.5G (from nominally 622 Mbit/s to nominally 2.67 Gbit/s) NRZ 10G (nominally 2.4 Gbit/s to nominally 10.71 Gbit/s)

jnxoptIfOChFEC.name: jnxoptIfOChFEC
jnxoptIfOChFEC.description: This parameter indicates what Forward Error Correction (FEC) code is used at Source and Sink. GFEC (from G709) and the I.x EFEC's (G.975 - Table I.1 super FEC). 1 - No FEC 2 - GFEC 3 - I.2 EFEC 4 - I.3 EFEC 5 - I.4 EFEC 6 - I.5 EFEC 7 - I.6 EFEC 8 - I.7 EFEC 9 - I.8 EFEC 10 - I.9 EFEC 11 - 100G FEC (for new applications) 12 - 100G EFEC (for new applications) 99 - Vendor Specific

jnxoptIfOChSinkMaximumBERMantissa.name: jnxoptIfOChSinkMaximumBERMantissa
jnxoptIfOChSinkMaximumBERMantissa.description: This parameter indicate the maximum Bit(mantissa) error rate can be supported by the application at the Receiver. In case of FEC applications it is intended after the FEC correction.

jnxoptIfOChSinkMaximumBERExponent.name: jnxoptIfOChSinkMaximumBERExponent
jnxoptIfOChSinkMaximumBERExponent.description: This parameter indicate the maximum Bit(exponent) error rate can be supported by the application at the Receiver. In case of FEC applications it is intended after the FEC correction.

jnxoptIfOChMinWavelength.name: jnxoptIfOChMinWavelength
jnxoptIfOChMinWavelength.description: This parameter indicate minimum wavelength spectrum in a definite wavelength Band (L, C and S)

jnxoptIfOChMaxWavelength.name: jnxoptIfOChMaxWavelength
jnxoptIfOChMaxWavelength.description: This parameter indicate maximum wavelength spectrum in a definite wavelength Band (L, C and S)

jnxoptIfOChWavelength.name: jnxoptIfOChWavelength
jnxoptIfOChWavelength.description: This parameter indicates the wavelength value.

jnxoptIfOChVendorTransceiverClass.name: jnxoptIfOChVendorTransceiverClass
jnxoptIfOChVendorTransceiverClass.description: As defined in G.698 Vendors can summarize a set of parameters in a single proprietary parameter: the Class of transceiver. The Transceiver classification will be based on the Vendor Name and the main TX and RX parameters (i.e. Trunk Mode, Framing, Bit rate, Trunk Type etc). If this parameter is used, the MIB parameters specifying the Transceiver characteristics may not be significant and the vendor will be responsible to specify the Class contents and values. The Vendor can publish the parameters of its Classes or declare to be compatible with published Classes.(G) Optional for compliance. (not mentioned in G.698)

jnxoptIfOChOpticalInterfaceApplicationCo.name: jnxoptIfOChOpticalInterfaceApplicationCode
jnxoptIfOChOpticalInterfaceApplicationCo.description: This parameter indicates the transceiver application code at Ss and Rs as defined in [ITU.G698.2] Chapter 5.3

jnxoptIfOChLaserAdminState.name: jnxoptIfOChLaserAdminState
jnxoptIfOChLaserAdminState.description: The configured State of the laser: 0 - disabled 1 - enabled

jnxoptIfOChLaserOperationalState.name: jnxoptIfOChLaserOperationalState
jnxoptIfOChLaserOperationalState.description: The Operational Status of Laser: 0 - disabled 1 - Enabled 2 - fault 3 - degraded

jnxoptIfOChAdminState.name: jnxoptIfOChAdminState
jnxoptIfOChAdminState.description: The Administrative Status of an Interface: 0 - Out of Service 1 - In Service

jnxoptIfOChOperationalState.name: jnxoptIfOChOperationalState
jnxoptIfOChOperationalState.description: The Operational Status of an Interface: 0 - disabled 1 - enabled 2 - Fault 3 - Degraded

jnxoptIfOChSrcConfigTable.name: jnxoptIfOChSrcConfigTable
jnxoptIfOChSrcConfigTable.description: A configuration table of OCh Src (Ss) parameters.

jnxoptIfOChSrcConfigEntry.name: jnxoptIfOChSrcConfigEntry
jnxoptIfOChSrcConfigEntry.description: A conceptual row that contains the Src (Ss) configuration parameters for a given interface.

jnxoptIfOChMinimumMeanChannelOutputPower.name: jnxoptIfOChMinimumMeanChannelOutputPower
jnxoptIfOChMinimumMeanChannelOutputPower.description: The minimum mean launched power at Ss is the average power (in dbm) of a pseudo-random data sequence coupled into the DWDM link.

jnxoptIfOChMaximumMeanChannelOutputPower.name: jnxoptIfOChMaximumMeanChannelOutputPower
jnxoptIfOChMaximumMeanChannelOutputPower.description: The maximum mean launched power at Ss is the average power (in dbm) of a pseudo-random data sequence coupled into the DWDM link.

jnxoptIfOChMinimumCentralFrequency.name: jnxoptIfOChMinimumCentralFrequency
jnxoptIfOChMinimumCentralFrequency.description: The minimum central frequency is the nominal single-channel frequency (in THz) on which the digital coded information of the particular optical channel is modulated by use of the NRZ line code. Eg 191.5THz will be represented as 19150

jnxoptIfOChMaximumCentralFrequency.name: jnxoptIfOChMaximumCentralFrequency
jnxoptIfOChMaximumCentralFrequency.description: The maximum central frequency is the nominal single-channel frequency (in THz) on which the digital coded information of the particular optical channel is modulated by use of the NRZ line code. Eg 191.5THz will be represented as 19150

jnxoptIfOChMaximumSpectralExcursion.name: jnxoptIfOChMaximumSpectralExcursion
jnxoptIfOChMaximumSpectralExcursion.description: This is the maximum acceptable difference between the nominal central frequency (in GHz) of the channel and the minus 15 dB points of the transmitter spectrum furthest from the nominal central frequency measured at point Ss.

jnxoptIfOChMaximumTxDispersionOSNRPenalt.name: jnxoptIfOChMaximumTxDispersionOSNRPenalty
jnxoptIfOChMaximumTxDispersionOSNRPenalt.description: Defines a reference receiver that this penalty is measured with. Lowest OSNR at Ss with worst case (residual) dispersion minus the Lowest OSNR at Ss with no dispersion. Lowest OSNR at Ss with no dispersion

jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkConfigTable.name: jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkConfigTable
jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkConfigTable.description: A table of paramters for the optical path from Src to Sink (Ss to Rs).

jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkConfigEntry.name: jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkConfigEntry
jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkConfigEntry.description: A conceptual row that contains the optical path Src-Sink (Ss-Rs) configuration parameters for a given interface.

jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMinimumChromaticDisper.name: jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMinimumChromaticDispersion
jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMinimumChromaticDisper.description: These parameters define the minimum value of the optical path 'end to end chromatic dispersion' (in ps/nm) that the system shall be able to tolerate.

jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumChromaticDisper.name: jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumChromaticDispersion
jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumChromaticDisper.description: These parameters define the maximum value of the optical path 'end to end chromatic dispersion' (in ps/nm) that the system shall be able to tolerate.

jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMinimumSrcOpticalRetur.name: jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMinimumSrcOpticalReturnLoss
jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMinimumSrcOpticalRetur.description: These parameter defines minimum optical return loss (in dB) of the cable plant at the source reference point (Src/Ss), including any connectors.

jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumDiscreteReflect.name: jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumDiscreteReflectanceSrcToSink
jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumDiscreteReflect.description: Optical reflectance is defined to be the ratio of the reflected optical power pre.sent at a point, to the optical power incident to that point. Control of reflections is discussed extensively in ITU-T Rec. G.957.

jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumDifferentialGro.name: jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumDifferentialGroupDelay
jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumDifferentialGro.description: Differential group delay (DGD) is the time difference between the fractions of a pulse that are transmitted in the two principal states of polarization of an optical signal. For distances greater than several kilometres, and assuming random (strong) polarization mode coupling, DGD in a fibre can be statistically modelled as having a Maxwellian distribution.

jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumPolarisationDep.name: jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumPolarisationDependentLoss
jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumPolarisationDep.description: The polarisation dependent loss (PDL) is the difference (in dB) between the maximum and minimum values of the channel insertion loss (or gain) of the black-link from point SS to RS due to a variation of the state of polarization (SOP) over all SOPs.

jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumInterChannelCro.name: jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumInterChannelCrosstalk
jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkMaximumInterChannelCro.description: Inter-channel crosstalk is defined as the ratio of total power in all of the disturbing channels to that in the wanted channel, where the wanted and disturbing channels are at different wavelengths. The parameter specify the isolation of a link conforming to the 'black-link' approach such that under the worst- case operating conditions the inter-channel crosstalk at any reference point RS is less than the maximum inter-channel crosstalk value.

jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkInterFerometricCrossta.name: jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkInterFerometricCrosstalk
jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkInterFerometricCrossta.description: This parameter places a requirement on the isolation of a link conforming to the 'black-link' approach such that under the worst case operating conditions the interferometric crosstalk at any reference point RS is less than the maximum interferometric crosstalk value..

jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkOpticalPathOSNRPenalty.name: jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkOpticalPathOSNRPenalty
jnxoptIfOChSrcSinkOpticalPathOSNRPenalty.description: The optical path OSNR penalty is defined as the difference between the Lowest OSNR at Rs and Lowest OSNR at Ss that meets the BER requirement.

jnxoptIfOChSinkConfigTable.name: jnxoptIfOChSinkConfigTable
jnxoptIfOChSinkConfigTable.description: A table of OCh Sink (Rs) configuration parameters.

jnxoptIfOChSinkConfigEntry.name: jnxoptIfOChSinkConfigEntry
jnxoptIfOChSinkConfigEntry.description: A conceptual row that contains the Sink (Rs) configuration parameters for a given interface.

jnxoptIfOChSinkMinimumMeanIntputPower.name: jnxoptIfOChSinkMinimumMeanIntputPower
jnxoptIfOChSinkMinimumMeanIntputPower.description: The minimum values of the average received power (in dbm at point the Sink (Rs).

jnxoptIfOChSinkMaximumMeanIntputPower.name: jnxoptIfOChSinkMaximumMeanIntputPower
jnxoptIfOChSinkMaximumMeanIntputPower.description: The maximum values of the average received power (in dbm) at point the Sink (Rs).

jnxoptIfOChSinkMinimumOSNR.name: jnxoptIfOChSinkMinimumOSNR
jnxoptIfOChSinkMinimumOSNR.description: The minimum optical signal-to-noise ratio (OSNR) is the minimum value of the ratio of the signal power in the wanted channel to the highest noise power density in the range of the central frequency plus and minus the maximum spectral excursion.

jnxoptIfOChSinkOSNRTolerance.name: jnxoptIfOChSinkOSNRTolerance
jnxoptIfOChSinkOSNRTolerance.description: The receiver OSNR tolerance is defined as the minimum value of OSNR at point Sink (Rs) that can be tolerated while maintaining the maximum BER of the application. Sink (Rs).

jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentExtTable.name: jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentExtTable
jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentExtTable.description: A table of OCh sink etxension to the performance monitoring information for the current 15-minute interval.

jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentExtEntry.name: jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentExtEntry
jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentExtEntry.description: A conceptual row that contains OCh sink performance monitoring information for an interface for the current 15-minute interval.

jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentChromaticDispersio.name: jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentChromaticDispersion
jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentChromaticDispersio.description: Residual Chromatic Dispersion measured at Rx Transceiver port.

jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentOSNR.name: jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentOSNR
jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentOSNR.description: Current Optical Signal to Noise Ratio (OSNR) estimated at Rx Transceiver port .

jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentQ.name: jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentQ
jnxoptIfOChSinkCurrentQ.description: 'Q' factor estimated at Rx Transceiver port.

jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigTable.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigTable
jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigTable.description: A table of performance monitoring configuration for the type 'jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigLayer' layer.

jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigEntry.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigEntry
jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigEntry.description: A conceptual entry in the performance monitoring configuration for the type 'jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigLayer' layer.

jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigType.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigType
jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigType.description: This parameter indicates the parameters for the table are for the Near End or Far End performance data. 1 - Near End 2 - Far End

jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigLayer.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigLayer
jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigLayer.description: This parameter indicates the parameters for the table are for OTUk, ODUk, TCMn performance data. 1 - OTUk 2 - ODUk 3 - TCM The ODUk/TCM sublayer PM is not related to the black link PM management, but since this is a common PM model for the ODU/TCM layer, we may include it here.

jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigTCMLevel.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigTCMLevel
jnxoptIfOTNPMConfigTCMLevel.description: This parameter indicates the TCM level (1-6) if the PM is of the type TCM. This will be 0 for OTUK/ODUK.

jnxoptIfOTNPMESRInterval.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMESRInterval
jnxoptIfOTNPMESRInterval.description: This parameter indicates the measurement interval for error seconds ratio.

jnxoptIfOTNPMSESRInterval.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMSESRInterval
jnxoptIfOTNPMSESRInterval.description: This parameter indicates the measurement interval for severely error seconds ratio.

jnxoptIfOTNPMValidIntervals.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMValidIntervals
jnxoptIfOTNPMValidIntervals.description: The number of contiguous 15 minute intervals for which valid PM data is available for the particular interface.

jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinBip8Threshold.name: jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinBip8Threshold
jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinBip8Threshold.description: The number of Bip8 encountered by the interface within any given 15 minutes performance data collection period, which causes the SNMP agent to send jnxoptIf15MinThreshBip8TCA. One notification will be sent per interval per interface. A value of `0' will disable the notification.

jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinESsThreshold.name: jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinESsThreshold
jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinESsThreshold.description: The number of ES encountered by the interface within any given 15 minutes performance data collection period, which causes the SNMP agent to send jnxoptIf15MinThreshEsTCA. One notification will be sent per interval per interface. A value of `0' will disable the notification.

jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinSESsThreshold.name: jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinSESsThreshold
jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinSESsThreshold.description: The number of SES encountered by the interface within any given 15 minutes performance data collection period, which causes the SNMP agent to send jnxoptIf15MinThreshSESTCA. One notification will be sent per interval per interface. A value of `0' will disable the notification.

jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinUASsThreshold.name: jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinUASsThreshold
jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinUASsThreshold.description: The number of UAS encountered by the interface within any given 15 minutes performance data collection period, which causes the SNMP agent to send jnxoptIf15MinThreshUASTCA. One notification will be sent per interval per interface. A value of `0' will disable the notification.

jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinBBEsThreshold.name: jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinBBEsThreshold
jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinBBEsThreshold.description: The number of UAS encountered by the interface within any given 15 minutes performance data collection period, which causes the SNMP agent to send jnxoptIf15MinThreshBBETCA. One notification will be sent per interval per interface. A value of `0' will disable the notification.

jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourBip8Threshold.name: jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourBip8Threshold
jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourBip8Threshold.description: The number of Bip8 encountered by the interface within any given 24 Hour performance data collection period, which causes the SNMP agent to send jnxoptIf15MinThreshBip8TCA. One notification will be sent per interval per interface. A value of `0' will disable the notification.

jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourESsThreshold.name: jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourESsThreshold
jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourESsThreshold.description: The number of ES encountered by the interface within any given 24 hour performance data collection period, which causes the SNMP agent to send jnxoptIf24HourThreshEsTCA. One notification will be sent per 24 hour per interface. A value of `0' will disable the notification.

jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourSESsThreshold.name: jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourSESsThreshold
jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourSESsThreshold.description: The number of SES encountered by the interface within any given 24 hour performance data collection period, which causes the SNMP agent to send jnxoptIf24HourThreshSESsTCA. One notification will be sent per 24 hour per interface. A value of `0' will disable the notification.

jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourUASsThreshold.name: jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourUASsThreshold
jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourUASsThreshold.description: The number of SES encountered by the interface within any given 24 hour performance data collection period, which causes the SNMP agent to send jnxoptIf24HourThreshUASsTCA. One notification will be sent per 24 hour per interface. A value of `0' will disable the notification.

jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourBBEsThreshold.name: jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourBBEsThreshold
jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourBBEsThreshold.description: The number of BBE encountered by the interface within any given 24 hour performance data collection period, which causes the SNMP agent to send jnxoptIf24HourThreshBBEsTCA. One notification will be sent per 24 hour per interface. A value of `0' will disable the notification.

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentTable.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentTable
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentTable.description: A table for the Performance monitoring Current Table.

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentEntry.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentEntry
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentEntry.description: A conceptual entry in the Near end or Far End performance monitoring Current table for the type 'jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentLayer' layer.

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentType.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentType
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentType.description: This parameter indicates the parameters for the table are for the Near End or Far End performance data. 1 - Near End 2 - Far End

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentLayer.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentLayer
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentLayer.description: This parameter indicates the parameters for the table are for OTUk, ODUk, TCMn performance data. 1 - OTUk (OCh which is used for the black link) 2 - ODUk 3 - TCM The ODUk/TCM sublayer PM is not related to the black link PM management, but since this is a common PM model for the ODU/TCM layer, we may include it here.

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentTCMLevel.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentTCMLevel
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentTCMLevel.description: This parameter indicates the TCM level (1-6) if the PM is of the type TCM. This will be 0 for OTUK/ODUK.

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentSuspectedFlag.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentSuspectedFlag
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentSuspectedFlag.description: If true, the data in this entry may be unreliable.

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentBip8.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentBip8
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentBip8.description: Number of Failures occurred in an observation period.

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentESs.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentESs
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentESs.description: This is the number of seconds in which one or more bits are in error or during which Loss of Signal (LOS) or Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) is detected.

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentSESs.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentSESs
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentSESs.description: The number of seconds which have a severe error. This is the number of seconds in which the bit-error ratio = 1x10Eminus3 or during which Loss of Signal (LOS) or Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) is detected.

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentUASs.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentUASs
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentUASs.description: It is the number of unavailable seconds. A period of unavailable time begins at the onset of ten consecutive SES events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of unavailable time. A new period of available time begins at the onset of ten consecutive non-SES events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of available time.

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentBBEs.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentBBEs
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentBBEs.description: An errored block not occurring as part of an SES.

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentESR.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentESR
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentESR.description: The ratio of ES in available time to total seconds in available time during a fixed measurement interval.

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentSESR.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentSESR
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentSESR.description: The ratio of SES in available time to total seconds in available time during a fixed measurement interval.

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentBBER.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentBBER
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentBBER.description: The ratio of BER in available time to total seconds in available time during a fixed measurement interval.

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentElapsedTime.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentElapsedTime
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurrentElapsedTime.description: Time elapsed for this 15 minute interval

jnxoptIfOTNPMCurSuspectReason.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMCurSuspectReason
jnxoptIfOTNPMCurSuspectReason.description: If SuspectedFlag is true, the reson for the PM data being suspect. 0 - not applicable 1 - unknown 2 - new object 3 - interface disabled 4 - clock shift detected 5 - cleared by user 6 - interval too short secs < 890 7 - interval too long secs > 910 8 - near end unavailable 9 - far end unavailable 10 - partial data 11 - missing intervals due to restarts

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalEntry.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalEntry
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalEntry.description: A conceptual entry in the Near end or Far End performance monitoring Interval table for the type 'jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalLayer' layer.

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalType.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalType
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalType.description: This parameter indicates the parameters for the table are for the Near End or Far End performance data. 1 - Near End 2 - Far End

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalLayer.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalLayer
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalLayer.description: This parameter indicates the parameters for the table are for OTUk, ODUk, TCMn performance data. 1 - OTUk 2 - ODUk 3 - TCM The ODUk/TCM sublayer PM is not related to the black link PM management, but since this is a common PM model for the ODU/TCM layer, we may include it here.

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalTCMLevel.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalTCMLevel
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalTCMLevel.description: This parameter indicates the TCM level (1-6) if the PM is of the type TCM. This will be 0 for OTUK/ODUK.

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalNumber.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalNumber
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalNumber.description: A number between 1 and 96, where 1 is the most recently completed 15 minute interval and 96 is the 15 minutes interval completed 23 hours and 45 minutes prior to interval 1.

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalSuspectedFlag.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalSuspectedFlag
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalSuspectedFlag.description: If true, the data in this entry may be unreliable.

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalBip8.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalBip8
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalBip8.description: Number of Failures occurred in an observation period.

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalESs.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalESs
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalESs.description: It is a one-second period in which one or more bits are in error or during which Loss of Signal (LOS) or Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) is detected.

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalSESs.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalSESs
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalSESs.description: The number of seconds which have a severe error. It is a one-second period which has a bit-error ratio = 1x10Eminus3 or during which Loss of Signal (LOS) or Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) is detected.

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalUASs.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalUASs
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalUASs.description: It is the number of unavailable seconds in this 15 minute interval. A period of unavailable time begins at the onset of ten consecutive SES events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of unavailable time. A new period of available time begins at the onset of ten consecutive non-SES events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of available time.

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalBBEs.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalBBEs
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalBBEs.description: An errored block not occurring as part of an SES.

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalESR.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalESR
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalESR.description: The ratio of ES in available time to total seconds in available time during a fixed measurement interval.

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalSESR.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalSESR
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalSESR.description: The ratio of SES in available time to total seconds in available time during a fixed measurement interval.

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalBBER.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalBBER
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntervalBBER.description: The ratio of BBE in available time to total seconds in available time during a fixed measurement interval.

jnxoptIfOTNPMIntSuspectReason.name: jnxoptIfOTNPMIntSuspectReason
jnxoptIfOTNPMIntSuspectReason.description: If SuspectedFlag is true, the reson for the PM data being suspect. 0 - not applicable 1 - unknown 2 - new object 3 - interface disabled 4 - clock shift detected 5 - cleared by user 6 - interval too short secs < 890 7 - interval too long secs > 910 8 - near end unavailable 9 - far end unavailable 10 - partial data 11 - missing intervals due to restarts

jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinPreFECBERMantissaThres.name: jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinPreFECBERMantissaThreshold
jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinPreFECBERMantissaThres.description: BER (mantissa) by the interface within any given 15 minutes performance data collection period, which causes the SNMP agent to send jnxoptIf15MinThreshPreFECBERTCA. One notification will be sent per interval per interface. A value of `0' will disable the notification.

jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinPreFECBERExponentThres.name: jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinPreFECBERExponentThreshold
jnxoptIfOTNPM15MinPreFECBERExponentThres.description: The Pre FEC BER (exponent) by the interface within any given 15 minutes performance data collection period, which causes the SNMP agent to send jnxoptIf15MinThreshPreFECBERTCA. One notification will be sent per interval per interface. A value of `0' will disable the notification.

jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourPreFECBERMantissaThre.name: jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourPreFECBERMantissaThreshold
jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourPreFECBERMantissaThre.description: BER (mantissa) by the interface within any given 24 Hour performance data collection period, which causes the SNMP agent to send jnxoptIf5s24Hour15MinThreshPreFECBERTCA. One notification will be sent per 24 hour period per interface. A value of `0' will disable the notification.

jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourPreFECBERExponentThre.name: jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourPreFECBERExponentThreshold
jnxoptIfOTNPM24HourPreFECBERExponentThre.description: The Pre FEC BER (exponent) by the interface within any given 24 Hour performance data collection period, which causes the SNMP agent to send jnxoptIf5s24Hour15MinThreshPreFECBERTCA. One notification will be sent per 24 hour period per interface. A value of `0' will disable the notification.
